posts.content:
Hi everyone.

I asked for this new section to be added to the website for several reasons

Its a good place to formulate and incubate ideas for the magazine, with YOUR input, so if you have any feedback for what YOU would like to see in the club mag, start a topic for discussion.

i'm happy for you all to share short article for inclusion (or just the ideas) funny things you have seen, stories you have heard, queries you may have etc etc…..think of this section as an online virtual letter page

its also a good place to show off the Magazine, cover shots, historic articles etc….


thanks everyone and lets see what happens

Could we have a sticky post in the member's section in which soft copies of the magazine are posted, perhaps with a brief summary of what is in that issue, so we can search for old articles?

I'd rather have a soft copy of the magazine anyhow. I tend to hang on to the paper ones unnecessarily after I've read them, probably out of respect for the amount of effort that goes in to producing them. Eventually they end up in the recycling though.

Soft would be better for me and an archive in the member's section would allow us to find old articles.

yeah, its certainly something to look at doing in the future.

i do plan on scanning historic articles as I work through them and putting those on, but a searchable archive is probably a bit complex…for now

maddison wrote:yeah, its certainly something to look at doing in the future.

i do plan on scanning historic articles as I work through them and putting those on, but a searchable archive is probably a bit complex…for now


Thanks. I was thinking more like a pdf attachment for the future issues as they get released. Assuming they get sent to the printer as pdfs?
not sure about release in time with the mag…kind of kills the excitement of getting it in your hands through the post

author.location: Bridgnorth, Shropshire. I am a member :o)

posts.content:
Hi Maddison,

Talking about the historic articles - can I just say how much I enjoyed the 'old issues' section in the last few mags - I found them fascinating - to see how far the mag has progressed and to see how the club has changed (or not) over the years.

I'm hoping this stays a regular feature!

Cheers TED

P.S And a big up to Brian Screaton - what a contributor!

yep agreed, Brian is a legend

wait for the issue on its way, another fab article by him
You're doing a cracking job Steve - always enjoy the mag coming through, especially with those arty pics
